security: Disclosing the identities of proprietary employees and assets, such as Joaquin SANJENIS Perdome and Juan A. PAULA, along with details of their business activities and connections to the Agency, could jeopardize their safety and compromise ongoing operations. Revealing the existence and function of MHMUTUAL, its association with McKERCHER and AVANT, and its link to NORTHWEST MANAGEMENT SERVICES INC, could expose cover operations and methods of financial support for imprisoned assets. Mentioning that Howard HUNT was aware of MHMUTUAL when he served as C/CA/EUR connects a figure involved in Watergate to Agency operations, potentially drawing unwanted scrutiny. Detailing the office setup where MHMUTUAL employees monitor phone calls for John DEAN's attorneys and the high volume of media inquiries and overseas calls, could suggest clandestine surveillance activities and compromise the law firm's confidentiality. Specifically, the document states: "Among other duties performed by the proprietary are the monthly checks sent to the dependents of imprisoned assets which are signed in true name by PAULA...EVANS feels that MHMUTUAL is protected and compartmented...He feels that either proprietary could only be linked to the Agency by innuendo...The common receptionist area is manned by MHMUTUAL employees who also monitor all telephone calls..."
summary: A memorandum reports a media inquiry by someone claiming to work for the New York Times, regarding Cuban involvement in the Watergate case and related attitudes in Miami, prompting a briefing on potential exposure of Agency assets and proprietaries.
summary_one_paragraph: On May 6, 1973, a memorandum from James E. Flannery, Acting Chief of the Western Hemisphere Division, to the Deputy Director for Operations details a media inquiry made to Rene VIERA Gonzalez, a Cuban exile journalist in Miami, by an individual claiming to be
title: Media Inquiry to Cuban Exile Journalist in Miami re Cuban Involvement in Watergate Case and Attitudes in Miami Area
